conclusion: Four identical wooden blocks on a smooth surface; B and C connected by a spring; force F applied to B.
Blocks B and C are connected by a spring; surface is smooth; blocks are stacked.
Friction must exist between D and C to prevent sliding during acceleration.
Block B is on the ground; A on top of B; C on the ground; D on top of C; B and C connected by a spring; force F applied to B.
Friction forces act between stacked blocks to ensure they don't slide relative to each other.
Mass of each block is m; total mass is 4m.
Acceleration a = F / (4m) using Newton's second law.
For block D, friction force f_D = m * a.
For block C, spring force F_s - f_D = m * a.
Spring force F_s acts leftward on C; friction force f_D acts rightward on D.
Net force on block C is F_s (leftward) plus f_D (rightward) equals m * a.
Block D exerts a friction force on block C; only horizontal force on C is spring force F_s.
